This page contains the complete documentation for each function in the pegg module.

pegg.prime.pegg2.PAM_finder(seq, PAM)Â¶

Finds indeces of PAM sequences Formatting: e.g. â€œNGGâ€ N = [A|T|C|G] R = [A|G] Y = [C|T] S = [G|C] W = [A|T] K = [G|T] M = [A|C] B = [C|G|T] D = [A|G|T] H = [A|C|T] V = [A|C|G]

pegg.prime.pegg2.RF_score(df)Â¶
pegg.prime.pegg2.df_formatter(df, chrom_dict, context_size=120)Â¶

Takes in variants (in cBioPortal format!) and outputs dataframe with WT and ALT oligos with designated context_size context_size = the amount of nt on either side of the variant e.g. AAA(A/G)AAA = context_size of 3 cols_to_save = information to save about the mutationsâ€¦(can modify beyond defaultsâ€¦)

pegg.prime.pegg2.eligible_PAM_finder(mut, PAM, max_RTT_length, proto_size=19)Â¶

Determines eligible PAM sequences for creating pegRNAsâ€¦

pegg.prime.pegg2.genome_loader(filepath_gz)Â¶

Takes in filepath of human genome (GrCH37 or GrCh38) and returns records and index_list for PEGG parsing.

filepath_gz

type = str

The filepath to the .gz file holding the reference genome file.

takes as input sequence in prime design format e.g. AATTCCG(G/C)AATTCGCT

pegg.prime.pegg2.sensor_generator(df, proto_size, before_proto_context=5, sensor_length=60, sensor_orientation='reverse-complement')Â¶

Generates sensor sequence for quantification of pegRNA editing outcomes Automatically puts sensor in reverse complement orientation with respect to protospacer This is highly reccomended to reduce recombination during cloning/library preparation

options for sensor_orienation = â€˜reverse_compâ€™; â€˜forwardâ€™
